intro: Plinia marqueteana, commonly known as the Marquette persimmon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in the Carolinas and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. It produces edible berries that are typically orange to red in color when mature. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
